title: [Large-Scale] P+E Framework-Based Instructional Design for Strengthening Presence in Online Social Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary social studies teaching methods and experience with online learning environments
context.additional_context: VR simulation-based program to strengthen competency in designing immersive social studies lessons

learning_goals: Learners implement VR-based lesson designs applying the three presences of the CoI model (social, cognitive, teaching) with 80% accuracy

Learners create three or more VR simulation tasks reflecting Kolb’s Experiential Learning Cycle’s four stages (Concrete Experience – Reflective Observation – Abstract Conceptualization – Active Experimentation)
Learners validate through peer assessment that presence elements are holistically integrated in their instructional designs, achieving an average of 4 or higher on a 5-point scale
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
